animation

Class Slide

  • java.lang.Object
    • animation.Slide
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Slide
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    models a slide used in animations
    Author:
    abrah

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()

      • display

        public boolean display(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        displays this slide to the graphics2d g, and returns true after it has been displayed for its time you can only display once. If you want to display again, you must call reset() on a slide. However, if you call this function after it returns false, it will still draw to the screen. But it returned false so you would know not to call it anymore.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphcis to be used for drawing
        Returns:
        true if it has displayed for its amount of time, false otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets the timer on this slide. Don't use it really
